For more information, see the documentation at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/install-CloudWatch-Agent-on-EC2-Instance.html.

name: ebs-volume-usage-test-linux
description: The EBS volume usage test creates an EBS volume and attaches it to the instance. It creates a temporary file on the volume and detaches the volume. It reattaches the volume and validates the file exists. It then detaches and deletes the volume. In order to perform this test, an IAM policy with ec2:AttachVolume, ec2:CreateTags, ec2:DetachVolume, ebs:CreateVolume, ebs:DeleteVolume and ebs:DescribeVolumes actions is required.

name: ebs-volume-usage-test-linux
description: The EBS volume usage test creates an EBS volume and attaches it to the instance. It creates a temporary file on the volume and detaches the volume. It reattaches the volume and validates that the file exists. It then detaches and deletes the volume. To perform this test, an IAM policy with the following actions is required: ec2:AttachVolume, ec2:CreateTags, ec2:CreateVolume, ec2:DeleteVolume, ec2:DescribeVolumes, and ec2:DetachVolume.

name: ebs-volume-usage-test-linux
description: The EBS volume usage test creates an EBS volume and attaches it to the instance. It creates a temporary file on the volume and detaches the volume. It reattaches the volume and validates that the file exists. It then detaches and deletes the volume. To perform this test, an IAM policy with the following actions is required: ec2:AttachVolume, ec2:Create Tags, ec2:CreateVolume, ec2:DeleteVolume, ec2:DescribeVolumes, and ec2:DetachVolume.

name: ebs-volume-usage-test-linux
description: The EBS volume usage test creates an EBS volume and attaches it to the instance. It creates a temporary file on the volume and detaches the volume. It reattaches the volume and validates that the file exists. It then detaches and deletes the volume. To perform this test, an IAM policy with the following actions is required: ec2:AttachVolume, ec2:Create Tags, ec2:CreateVolume, ec2:DeleteVolume, ec2:DescribeVolumes, and ec2:DetachVolume.

name: ebs-volume-usage-test-linux
description: The EBS volume usage test performs the following actions: 1) It creates an EBS volume and attaches it to the instance. 2) It creates a temporary file on the volume and detaches the volume. 3) It reattaches the volume and validates that the file exists. 4) It detaches and deletes the volume. To perform this test, an IAM policy with the following actions is required: ec2:AttachVolume, ec2:Create Tags, ec2:CreateVolume, ec2:DeleteVolume, ec2:DescribeVolumes, and ec2:DetachVolume.

name: eni-attachment-test-linux
description: The ENI attachment test creates an ENI and attaches it to the instance. It validates the attached ENI has an IP address. It then detaches and deletes the ENI. In order to perform this test, an IAM policy with ec2:AttachNetworkInterface, ec2:CreateTags, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaceAttribute, ec2:DetachNetworkInterface, eni:CreateNetworkInterface, eni:DeleteNetworkInterface and eni:DescribeNetworkInterface actions is required.

name: eni-attachment-test-linux
description: The ENI attachment test creates an ENI and attaches it to the instance. It validates that the attached ENI has an IP address. It then detaches and deletes the ENI. To perform this test, an IAM policy with the following actions is required: ec2:AttachNetworkInterface, ec2:CreateNetworkInterface, ec2:CreateTags, ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaceAttribute, and ec2:DetachNetworkInterface.

name: eni-attachment-test-linux
description: The ENI attachment test creates an ENI and attaches it to the instance. It validates that the attached ENI has an IP address. It then detaches and deletes the ENI. To perform this test, an IAM policy with the following actions is required: ec2:AttachNetworkInterface, ec2:CreateNetworkInterface, ec2:CreateTags, ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaceAttribute, and ec2:DetachNetworkInterface.

name: eni-attachment-test-linux
description: The ENI attachment test creates an ENI and attaches it to the instance. It validates that the attached ENI has an IP address. It then detaches and deletes the ENI. To perform this test, an IAM policy with the following actions is required: ec2:AttachNetworkInterface, ec2:CreateNetworkInterface, ec2:CreateTags, ec2:DeleteNetworkInterface, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaces, ec2:DescribeNetworkInterfaceAttribute, and ec2:DetachNetworkInterface.

name: go-linux

name: inspector-test-linux
description: Inspector Test. Requires AmazonInspectorFullAccess IAM policy, ssm:SendCommand and ec2:CreateTags IAM permissions

name: inspector-test-linux
description: Performs a Center for Internet Security (CIS) security assessment of an instance with AWS Inspector Service. This component installs the AWS Inspector agent, creates a resource group, assessment target, and assessment template, and runs the assessment. A link to the results is provided in the logs and on the AWS Inspector Service console. In order to run successfully, this component requires that the AmazonInspectorFullAccess IAM policy and the ssm:SendCommand and ec2:CreateTags IAM permissions are attached to the instance profile.

name: inspector-test-linux
description: Performs a Center for Internet Security (CIS) security assessment of an instance with AWS Inspector Service. This component installs the AWS Inspector agent, creates a resource group, assessment target, and assessment template, and runs the assessment. A link to the results is provided in the logs and on the AWS Inspector Service console. In order to run successfully, this component requires that the AmazonInspectorFullAccess IAM policy and the ssm:SendCommand and ec2:CreateTags IAM permissions are attached to the instance profile.

name: update-linux-kernel-mainline
description: Installs the latest mainline release of the Linux kernel. For Amazon Linux 2, this will install the 'kernel-ng' package from Amazon Linux Extras. For CentOS 7 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and 8, this will install the 'kernel-ml' package from https://www.elrepo.org.

name: update-linux-kernel-mainline
description: Installs the latest mainline release of the Linux kernel. For Amazon Linux 2, this will install the 'kernel-ng' package from Amazon Linux Extras. For CentOS 7 and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and 8, this will install the 'kernel-ml' package from https://www.elrepo.org.

name: update-linux
description: Updates Linux with the latest security updates.

name: update-linux
description: Updates Linux with the latest security updates.

name: update-linux
description: Updates Linux by installing all available updates via the UpdateOS action module.

name: validate-single-ssh-public-key-test-linux
description: Checks if the latest ssh public key provided by the Instance Metadata is the only ssh public key present on instance. The test passes if there is exactly one key present and fails if zero or more than one key exists.

name: validate-single-ssh-public-key-test-linux
description: Ensures the `authorized_keys` file contains only the SSH public key returned from the EC2 Instance Metadata Service.

name: validate-ssh-host-key-generation-linux
description: Checks if the ssh host key was generated after latest boot.

name: validate-ssh-host-key-generation-linux
description: Verifies whether the SSH host key was generated after the latest boot.

name: validate-ssh-public-key-linux
description: Checks if the latest ssh public key provided by the Instance Metadata is present on instance. This test does not assert that public key from Instance Metadata is the only key present.

name: validate-ssh-public-key-linux
description: Ensures the `authorized_keys` file contains the SSH public key returned from the EC2 Instance Metadata Service.

name: yum-repository-test-linux
description: Tests whether yum repository works successfully
